author: Nistula Hebbar
text:
The BJP has said it is ready to form a government or face fresh elections in Uttarakhand.

“The BJP is ready for both options. If the Governor invites us to form a government, we are ready to do so. We are also ready to face fresh polls,” BJP general secretary in charge of the State Kailash Vijayvargiya said after President’s Rule was imposed on the State on Sunday.

The BJP has 28 MLAs in the Assembly which has a total strength of 70 (plus one nominated member). One BJP MLA, Bhimlal Arya, is estranged from the party. This leaves the party’s effective strength at 27. The Speaker had on Saturday disqualified nine rebel Congress MLAs. “I have not been informed of the proclamation of President’s Rule,” he said in Dehradun. It is not clear whether the disqualification can stand judicial scrutiny.

Senior BJP leader Bhagat Singh Koshiyari is among the front-runners for Chief Minister. The BJP has been unhappy with Governor K.K. Paul’s decision to give 10 days to Chief Minister Harish Rawat to prove his majority in the Assembly.
title: BJP ready to form govt.: Vijayvargiya
